result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Def in person & by Atty Nadya E Perez-Reyes.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  Defendant appeared late; case recalled.  Court vacates previously ordered warrant and bail forfeiture.  State moves to dismiss and read in along with plea to Ct. 1 in 14CF536 and 14CF358 and Court so orders.  1-26-15 Jury trial removed from Court's calendar.
Atty Nadya E Perez-Reyes appearing for Def.  Atty Peter John Cannon for State.  Court issues a warrant and bail forfeiture.  Trial to remain on Court's calendar.
1-07-15 Jury Status Hearing rescheduled to 1-13-15 at 1:30 p.m. in Branch III for global resolution.
State's Discovery Demand
Jury status hearing on January 7, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Jury trial on January 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Def in person & by Atty Nadya E Perez-Reyes.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  Not guilty plea entered.  One day jury trial requested.  Jury trial scheduled for January 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for January 7, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Letter received from Atty Giernoth
Arraignment on November 5, 2014 at 02:45 pm.

Def appears in custody & w/Atty Nadya E. Perez-Reyes.  Atty Mark D. Bensen for State.  Defendant has new charges pending and taken into custody today due to a missed court appearance.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information.  Arraignment scheduled for November 5, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
